name: anaerobic digestion plant construction, for sewage sludge | anaerobic digestion plant, for sewage sludge | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4500/documentation

This dataset represents the production of the reference product "anaerobic digestion plant, for sewage sludge" and the co-product "waste reinforced concrete". Infrastructure is accounted for with a lifetime of 30 years.  For stationary machines a lifetime of 10 years is assumed.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From the land transformation/occupation and the reception of the construction materials (cast iron, concrete, and steel) at the construction place.

This activity ends with an anaerobic digestion plant constructed. The dataset includes only the facilities required for the anaerobic treatment of sewage sludge, including digestion tank and gasholder. Land occupation and land transformation are included, too.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Waste Treatment & Recycling

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data is obtained from a recent LCA study.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Swiss average technology. Data refers to an annual treatment of 50'000 PCE

exchanges.description:
Inlcudes the facilities required for the anaerobic treatment of sewage sludge (digestion tank and gas holder), as described in literature.
EcoSpold01Location=CH

flow.name: anaerobic digestion plant, for sewage sludge
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

exchanges.description: Literature value, uncertainties due to variation in size

Literature value, uncertainties due to variation in plant size.

Digestion tanks normally consist of a concrete vessel covered with concrete roof structures of different shape and structural design. The expenditures of bulk materials required for the construction of digestion
tanks and gasholder are available from literature. The data is linear adjusted to represent the life time expenditures for a 100’000 PCE plant. The operation of the vessels is assumed to be the same as the total plant (30 years). For stationary machines we assume a life time of 10 years.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Literature value, uncertainties due to variation in plant size.

Refers to the area occupied by the digestion tank and gasholder. The plant operation time is assumed to be 30 years. After that time the plant is expanded, renovated or closed down.

Literature provides land use figures for the surface covered by digestion tank and gasholder. In this study we assume a plant of 100’00 PCEs (upper limit class 2), with an area of 1140 m2, a digestion tank with 2700 m3 and a gasholder with 400 m3.

Literature value, uncertainties due to variation in plant size.

Digestion tanks normally consist of a concrete vessel covered with concrete roof structures of different shape and structural design. The expenditures of bulk materials required for the construction of digestion
tanks and gasholder are available from literature. The data is linear adjusted to represent the life time expenditures for a 100’000 PCE plant. The operation of the vessels is assumed to be the same as the total plant (30 years). For stationary machines we assume a life time of 10 years.
EcoSpold01Location=CH

exchanges.description:
Literature value, uncertainties due to variation in plant size.

Construction time is assumed to be 3 years (assuming that digestion of sludge is predominately performed on large wastewater treatment plants. During the construction time the total area is inventoried as 'construction site'.
